title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:01 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
00:17 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
01:57 <Ruudjah> has quit  
01:58 <Akiyama-san> has joined #xwiki  
02:00 <npm\_> is now known as <npm>  
02:01 <Akiyama-san> Hello, Im trying to create a xorg.conf on my laptop (running Ubuntu) using sudo Xorg -configure, and I always get this message "number of created screens does not match number of detected devices. Configuration failed". Does someone know how can I solve this?  
02:02 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
02:03 <sdumitriu> has quit  
02:04 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
02:07 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
02:11 <@cjdelisl1> Akiyama-san: it sounds like you have 2 montitors configured in xorg.conf and you don't have 2 monitors available  
02:12 <@cjdelisl1> also note that XWiki is not the same as xorg/xfree86 so you'll probably get better answers by asking someone else ;)  
02:12 <Akiyama-san> cjdelisl1: I have just reinstalled Ubuntu here because of this, I havent installed anything here yet, theres no way to have another monitor installed  
02:13 <@cjdelisl1> hmm  
02:14 <@cjdelisl1> sounds like a major problem, have you googles your make and model and ubuntu and the error message?  
02:14 <Akiyama-san> i have googled but havent found anything yet  
02:15 <Akiyama-san> anything that would help  
02:15 <@cjdelisl1> well best of luck, I've never heard of that problem  
02:16 <Akiyama-san> ok, thanks anyway  
02:16 <Akiyama-san> ah, and i forgot to say  
02:17 <Akiyama-san> I have generate strange xorg.conf.new, but if I move it to /etc/X11, my X breaks  
02:17 <Akiyama-san> it\* have generated  
02:29 <sdumitriu> has quit  
02:29 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
02:33 <Akiyama-san> has quit  
05:02 <sdumitriu> has quit  
05:07 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
08:33 <tekzilla> has quit  
08:35 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <sdumitriu> has quit  
08:38 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
08:40 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
08:43 <sdumitriu> has quit  
09:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
09:33 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <jstoldt> has quit  
09:41 <vmassol> has quit  
11:44 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:48 <AndreasJonsson> I've just pushed my first commmit.  
12:49 <AndreasJonsson> Shouldn't I be able to assign jira-tasks to myself?  
12:49 <@cjdelisl1> congrats  
12:49 <@cjdelisl1> yes you should, do you not have access to on jira  
12:50 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
12:51 <sdumitriu> has quit  
13:00 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: yep let me fix jira  
13:03 <vmassol> abusenius: done, could you check it's ok now?  
13:03 <vmassol> ah wait, I forgot something  
13:04 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
13:04 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <vmassol> ok should be really ok now  
13:06 <+AndreasJonsson> Thanks!  Now I can assign issues.  
13:08 <@cjdelisl1> I was thinking about setting up a cia.vc account for xwiki and adding a bot to this channel to read out commits as they are pushed, any thoughts?  
13:12 <npm> has quit  
13:13 <vmassol> cjdelisl1: that's not needed AFAIK  
13:13 <vmassol> you simply need to add a botlet  
13:13 <vmassol> that uses github REST api  
13:13 <vmassol> very simple  
13:14 <vmassol> especially since I've already put some examples of that on extensions.xwiki.org  
13:14 <vmassol> ah you want the notification… hmmm  
13:14 <vmassol> then it's easy too  
13:14 <vmassol> since github can be configured to call a page  
13:14 <vmassol> when a commit is pushed  
13:14 <vmassol> so all we need to do is create that page and send the notif using the xwiki irc bot  
13:15 <@cjdelisl1> sounds like a lot of work, the nice thing about cia.vc is I just did it for my project and it's like a 10 minute job at most  
13:15 <@cjdelisl1> and everything "just works" from the start  
13:15 <vmassol> well I'd prefer that we use our bot  
13:15 <@cjdelisl1> ok  
13:15 <vmassol> it makes it even better  
13:15 <vmassol> that said I haven't done so so far because I'm not sure we need/want it  
13:15 <vmassol> (since we receive notification by email already)  
13:16 <vmassol> so that would be receiving the same information in two channels  
13:16 <vmassol> a bit overkill IMO  
13:17 <@cjdelisl1> the only advantage in my mind is that it's immediate and less likely to get lost in the flood of hudson spam.  
13:17 <vmassol> email is also immediate  
13:17 <vmassol> (within 2 minutes)  
13:17 <vmassol> and we cannot remove it  
13:17 <vmassol> because not everyone is on irc and people can be offline  
13:17 <@cjdelisl1> /nod  
13:17 <vmassol> so the email is better than the irc notifications in this regards  
13:18 <vmassol> it serves two purpose  
13:18 <vmassol> so the only question  
13:18 <vmassol> is whether people who are on irc are ok to receive all notifications twice  
13:18 <vmassol> you could ask on the devs list maybe  
13:18 <@cjdelisl1> IMO it's not so important that it's worth writing code for it.  
13:18 <vmassol> personally I'm 0 (maybe ?0 but I won't oppose it)  
13:31 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <+abusenius> vmassol: what did you want me to check?  
13:48 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
13:50 <sdumitriu> has quit  
14:35 <vmassol> abusenius: hmm I don't recall, what was it about?  
14:35 <vmassol> or when?  
16:08 <+abusenius> [12:51] <-- sdumitriu has left this server (Ping timeout: 248 seconds).  
16:08 <+abusenius> [12:58] [Away] You are now marked as being away.  
16:08 <+abusenius> [13:00] <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: yep let me fix jira  
16:08 <+abusenius> [13:03] <vmassol> abusenius: done, could you check it's ok now?  
16:08 <+abusenius> [13:03] [Away] You are no longer marked as being away.  
16:08 <+abusenius> [13:03] [Away] You are not marked as being away.  
16:08 <+abusenius> [13:04] <vmassol> ah wait, I forgot something  
16:08 <@cjdelisl1> looks like tabcompletefail  
16:09 <vmassol> abusenius: yes sorry I ping the wrong person  
16:09 <vmassol> Wanted to ping Andreas  
16:09 <+abusenius> ah, ok  
16:09 <vmassol> as cjdelisl1 said it was an auto complete fail  
17:10 <+AndreasJonsson> There were only one response to the vote on wether delete rights should be considered at document level:  
17:10 <+AndreasJonsson> http://www.mail-archive.com/[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)/msg20213.html  
17:11 <+AndreasJonsson> Should the vote be proposed again or can it be considered passed anyway?  
17:58 <vmassol> just had some week end fun: http://vimeo.com/30980990 :) (need to finish packaging it for extensions.xwiki.org)  
17:59 <vmassol> (going in the garden)  
19:00 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
19:20 <vmassol> for those who want to try it out: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/102729/presentation-html5.xar  
21:06 <sdumitriu1> Looks great vmassol  
21:07 <JuanDaugherty> has no audio though right?  
21:07 <sdumitriu1> Probably, I didn't hear any either  
21:08 <JuanDaugherty> didn't think so but wanted to check  
22:28 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
22:34 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
22:57 <vmassol> JuanDaugherty: indeed, I didn't record any audio since my 3 kids + a friends were playing around me yelling! ;)  
23:07 <vmassol> has quit  
23:08 <abusenius> has quit  
23:31 <mflorea> has quit
